title: Do white ink tattoos turn green? - Quora

response.answer_text: No - there is no green or blue pigment in white. All white tattoos are difficult to do. They tend to burn out in some reason and can look splotchy over time. White Ink Tattoos: Pros and Cons | Custom Tattoo Design Black tattoos done with India ink are the ones that turn blue or green. I have a 40 year old tattoo done in Costa Rica that’s turned bluish green and gotten blurry on the edges - it’s due for a cover up soon.

I don’t have any pure-white tattoos, nor have I ever seen one IRL. I do have white as highlights on a couple of my tattoos. The white has not turned green at all. It has stayed white…perhaps, over the years, it’s a bit of an ivory tone. The color is pretty, I’d compare it to piano keys.
